# The `ScheduleHazardRecognizer` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

HazardRecognizer - This determines whether or not an instruction can be issued this cycle, and whether or not a noop needs to be inserted to handle the hazard. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::ScheduleHazardRecognizer</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

HazardRecognizer - This determines whether or not an instruction can be issued this cycle, and whether or not a noop needs to be inserted to handle the hazard.

## Public Member Functions

### AdvanceCycle() {#ad54a4120d2dfe3212b807c1f3ad80255}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual void llvm::ScheduleHazardRecognizer::AdvanceCycle ()"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
AdvanceCycle - This callback is invoked whenever the next top-down instruction to be scheduled cannot issue in the current cycle, either because of latency or resource conflicts.

This should increment the internal state of the hazard recognizer so that previously &quot;Hazard&quot; instructions will now not be hazards.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h/#l00104">104</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h">ScheduleHazardRecognizer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getHazardType() {#ae5c28a180502d1923c854952292cf5f6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual HazardType llvm::ScheduleHazardRecognizer::getHazardType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;, int Stalls=0)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
getHazardType - Return the hazard type of emitting this node.

There are three possible results. Either:
<ul>
<li>NoHazard: it is legal to issue this instruction on this cycle.</li>
<li>Hazard: issuing this instruction would stall the machine. If some other instruction is available, issue it first.</li>
<li>NoopHazard: issuing this instruction would break the program. If some other instruction can be issued, do so, otherwise issue a noop.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h/#l00060">60</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h">ScheduleHazardRecognizer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### PreEmitNoops() {#aea4423b99e356d0ad170024f736fb4f1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual unsigned llvm::ScheduleHazardRecognizer::PreEmitNoops (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
PreEmitNoops - This callback is invoked prior to emitting an instruction.

It should return the number of noops to emit prior to the provided instruction. Note: This is only used during PostRA scheduling. EmitNoop is not called for these noops.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h/#l00082">82</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h">ScheduleHazardRecognizer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Reset() {#a3c5a10c0a8121d68c2a8eef15395ee41}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual void llvm::ScheduleHazardRecognizer::Reset ()"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Reset - This callback is invoked when a new block of instructions is about to be schedule.

The hazard state should be set to an initialized state.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h/#l00067">67</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h">ScheduleHazardRecognizer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ShouldPreferAnother() {#a8e1b9c34eac5882a1e8e6e834222d3be}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::ScheduleHazardRecognizer::ShouldPreferAnother (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42;)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
ShouldPreferAnother - This callback may be invoked if getHazardType returns NoHazard.

If, even though there is no hazard, it would be better to schedule another available instruction, this callback should return true.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h/#l00095">95</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h">ScheduleHazardRecognizer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<SectionDefinition>

## Protected Member Attributes

### MaxLookAhead {#a6acf461721a59cf5cf404b80b5f57f86}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::ScheduleHazardRecognizer::MaxLookAhead = 0"
  labels = {["protected"]}>
MaxLookAhead - Indicate the number of cycles in the scoreboard state.

Important to restore the state after backtracking. Additionally, MaxLookAhead=0 identifies a fake recognizer, allowing the client to bypass virtual calls. Currently the PostRA scheduler ignores it.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h/#l00031">31</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/schedulehazardrecognizer-h">ScheduleHazardRecognizer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
